03:28 • 19 days ago

Veil

MAY JUNE TLDR … Catching up on Veil Discord and Twitter

For another bounty the recent Linux (GUI) setup guide has been joined by its macOS equivalent. Some code commits, especially to make it more friendly, have been made to the master branch ready for a minor wallet update.
Helpful changes to the Veil Core wallet code ready for a minor update (coming soon) A reminder in the command line (or Debug Console) help that “dumpprivkey” and “dumpwallet” does not include private keys for stealth addresses. “Use wallet.dat file or seed words for complete backup”. This note is also now added to the output of dumpwallet, to be sure. The “Overview” wallet page in the GUI wallet is where we normally see a list of transactions, but when someone starts the wallet without any transactions yet, it shows some information to help them get started! People can forget all about these things once a single transaction appears, and there was no way to see that page again! You might know it as the “Looks like you are new here” page! So a helpful contributor made a very neat way of displaying it again whenever you want, which also as a side-effect made the existing in-wallet FAQ much more accessible! The link to Veil.tools now works there too. Veil (incentive) Bounty Tasks

Please check Veil Telegram groups such as the Bounty Telegram, and other places where community work on Veil may have been notified. Any questions, please let us know and we will look into whether some old Veil bounties remain relevant, and you may find some new ones.

“Ohcee” (Github name) received bounty for a second of his Veil GUI SETUP GUIDES Veil wallet installation for the GUI Veil core wallet. 2023-06-11 This is also linked from the Wallet download / Get Started page.

The Veil Project: https://veil-project.com Veil Project, Discord: https://discord.veil-project.com

Veil-Dev, Discord: https://discord.gg/gGPcwxnSuR

Veil Bounty: https://t.me/VEILBounty Veil Announcements: https://t.me/VEILAnnouncements Veil Project en Español: https://t.me/VeilEspanol Veil Project Ru: https://t.me/VeilRussia

Veil Project (English): https://t.me/VEILProject

Veil on Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/Veil/ Veil on BitcoinTalk: https://bitcointalk.org/ … topic=5125073

(Please be aware of spam on Telegram and other third party websites. Our native community is on Discord.)

The Veil official TWITTER promo for MAY 2023 has completed

A 10,000 Veil bounty was paid to the indefatigable Veil enthusiast “VEILionaire | @veilminer007”! “@C0nt1ng3nt” came in a very worthy second, and received a 500 Veil bounty, while “Alex mail | @Alex_m_here” is offering his third place prize of 50 Veil (which we will double) to someone else who retweets and includes their Veil stealth address and follows his Twitter account and ours! It’s presently the pinned post on @ProjectVeil on Twitter — The exact tweet is here! Our favorite Veil meme artists are therefore currently VEILionaire and C0nt1ng3nt, with “Alex mail” providing enthusiastic support! 😀

Reminder that miners on Veil are currently SOLO mining ProgPoW without a pool

With the Veil price still a bargain, there was not enough money in it for our appreciated former ProgPow pool WoolyPooly to keep supporting the coin. There was another pool that started not long ago for RandomX, fastpool.xyz/, remind us if there are any others! SHA256D is still solo CPU mining. No ASICs developed. This would and will change with a much better Veil price, as incentives would make it happen.

TWITTER alternatives

Results from Twitter have not been up to expectations, so we would like to encourage people (and this is a call to the Veil team also) to get active on other platforms such as:

YOUTUBE @VEILProject @VeilCryptoPrivacy RUMBLE Rumble.com VIMEO Vimeo.com / Sean Phillips LBRY lbry.org » Odysee / Sean Crypto Phillips MASTODON @SeanPhillips GAB SPhillip TUMBLR veil-project TRUTH SOCIAL - Maybe try this too. truthsocial.com USA only? Tried Parler.com but it doesn’t even load any more. Please let us know (in our DISCORD) about any other platforms worth trying! Core development

More developers are coming in, but if you know of people who have an outstanding understanding of Applied Cryptography, ZK Proofs, zkSNARKs, and such things, like serious mathematicians, and have goals aligned with the Veil, cryptocurrency and Bitcoin community, they would be ideal candidates. We have a number of textbook PDFs for others who would like a refresher.

RingCT staking, while running on the development network is still awaiting some bug fixes and further rigorous testing.

The markets

The VEIL price and volume, last time checked on CoinGecko, there seems to be a bug in their data that suggests that not only there hasn’t been any volume for six days, (not true), that the price is $151.7 BILLION DOLLARS and the volume $207.6 million dollars! 🤪 Also NOT true!

On the other hand, on CoinMarketCap they are using PROBIT’s data, which in fact has days of zero volume, while TradeOgre’s price and volume is perfectly correct, just not what CoinGecko is currently showing you!

CoinGecko-priceError

Please check the Veil markets directly for the time being!

tradeogre.com/exchange/VEIL-BTC Probit.com…VEIL/BTC Probit.com…VEIL/USDT

More exchanges are in the works. Suggest your favourite decentralised exchanges (DEX) in our DISCORD !

00:00 • 19 days ago

Friday, 09. June 2023

Epicenter Podcast

Zac Williamson & Joe Andrews: Aztec - Privacy-preserving, hybrid ZK rollup

In order to achieve true transaction privacy, it is not enough to encrypt or build ZK proofs for transaction bundles, as long as the underlying blockchain uses an account-based model. Aztec is building a ZKVM that superposes an UTXO model, so that balances are constantly updated as new, untraceable, log entries. The upcoming Aztec 3 aims to enable privacy-preserving smart contracts, using a hybrid

In order to achieve true transaction privacy, it is not enough to encrypt or build ZK proofs for transaction bundles, as long as the underlying blockchain uses an account-based model. Aztec is building a ZKVM that superposes an UTXO model, so that balances are constantly updated as new, untraceable, log entries. The upcoming Aztec 3 aims to enable privacy-preserving smart contracts, using a hybrid, multi-layered rollup. This approach allows for both public and private smart contracts to be executed simultaneously.

We were joined by Zac Williamson & Joe Andrews, to discuss the evolution of Aztec, from ZK Money to their upcoming privacy-preserving hybrid ZK rollup.

Topics covered in this episode:

The evolution of Aztec, from ZK money to Aztec 3 How Aztec’s ZKVM ensures privacy for Ethereum transactions The need for UTXO model for privacy-preserving encrypted databases Interacting with public smart contracts in a private manner Technical roadmap and challenges faced along the way How Aztec differs from Mina protocol Recursive proofs Estimating gas Main-net sequencer decentralisation Goblin Plonk The future of programmable privacy

Episode links:

Zac Williamson on Twitter Joe Andrews on Twitter Aztec on Twitter

This episode is hosted by Felix Lutsch. Show notes and listening options: epicenter.tv/499

Ether.fan NFTs Accrue Rewards And Seed Solo Stakers

BlueYard Capital

BlueYard is hiring a Head of Crypto Research & Technology

We are currently navigating an era that stands apart in the history of technological innovation. Multiple, rapidly-evolving disciplines, such as blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, web3, breakthrough engineering, and synthetic biology, are increasingly intersecting and influencing one another. This convergence is weaving a rich, complex tapestry of possibilities and challenges. In this mix, cryp

We are currently navigating an era that stands apart in the history of technological innovation. Multiple, rapidly-evolving disciplines, such as blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, web3, breakthrough engineering, and synthetic biology, are increasingly intersecting and influencing one another. This convergence is weaving a rich, complex tapestry of possibilities and challenges.

In this mix, crypto networks play a pivotal role, demonstrating an ability to coordinate networks, data, algorithms, and computing resources like never before. This is not a stagnant revolution. The crypto landscape is undergoing constant evolution and shift, continually changing the way we conceive value, trust, and decentralized power.

At BlueYard Capital, we are deeply invested in understanding, navigating, and shaping this exciting convergence. Our mission is to actively contribute to this transformation, playing our part in ushering in a new era of technological possibilities.

The Role

To further drive our mission, we are opening a critical position — the Head of Crypto Research & Technology. This role is particularly suited to an experienced software engineer who thrives on fast-paced technological evolution and convergence. Here’s a brief overview of the expectations:

Deep Technical Expertise: You will master the intricacies of the ever-evolving crypto and web3 landscape, and grasp the broader picture of converging technologies. Evaluating Technologies: Your hands-on approach will be required to assess emerging technologies, build prototypes, and contribute to influential open-source projects. Industry Awareness: You will maintain a pulse on the latest advancements, identifying key gaps and opportunities in the dynamic crypto/web3 infrastructure. Tool Development: Beyond using existing resources, you will innovate and upkeep tools for tasks such as automated trend analysis and open-source project quality evaluation. Assisting Portfolio Companies: Occasionally, you will apply your technical expertise to assist our portfolio companies on focused projects. Long-term Theses Development: You will formulate insightful perspectives on the ongoing and future technological shifts and directions in the industry. Collaboration: You will spearhead partnerships with external researchers, developers, and organizations, broadening our collective knowledge and fostering lasting relationships in the industry. Publication & Presentation: Your findings will be published and presented through various channels to make BlueYard’s knowledge accessible to the tech community. Education: As the firm’s technical lighthouse, you’ll help keep our team updated with the latest in the technological sphere.

We are at a tipping point, where multiple fast-moving technological trends are colliding and influencing each other in unforeseen ways. As the Head of Crypto Research & Technology at BlueYard, you will not just witness this revolution, but actively participate in shaping its course.

For the experienced software engineer ready to dive headfirst into this intricate web of rapid technological evolution and convergence, we offer not just a job, but a vantage point to help shape the future.

If you are interested in the position, please send the following to team@blueyard.com:

Your CV If applicable, a collection of links that best characterize your online presence and/or coding projects

Our process will then be as follows:

After the initial screening, we will invite selected candidates for a video interview We will then invite a limited group of candidates for in-person interviews with both the team and our entrepreneurs A decision will be made shortly thereafter

Horizen - Blog

EON Updates: Upcoming Gobi Testnet Upgrade

The exciting mainnet launch of Horizen EON is around the corner! EON is our Ethereum Virtual Machine compatible sidechain, and we are performing some functional and security-related changes to ensure a smooth transition toward mainnet launch.  In particular, we are: The changes will be implemented on Tuesday, June 13, 2023. Please note that these changes […] The post EON Updates: Upcomin

The exciting mainnet launch of Horizen EON is around the corner! EON is our Ethereum Virtual Machine compatible sidechain, and we are performing some functional and security-related changes to ensure a smooth transition toward mainnet launch. 

In particular, we are:

Increasing the security of the network by changing some of the fee parameters. Implementing fixes to bugs that surfaced through our ongoing Bug Bounty program.

The changes will be implemented on Tuesday, June 13, 2023. Please note that these changes will not affect any user balances or smart contracts deployed on Gobi.

This communication is purely informational. There is no action required by any Gobi testnet smart contract developers.

Some important information

Gobi Hard fork activation is scheduled to happen during consensus epoch 624. Estimated time is June 13th 16:20 CET.  What do I need to do if I’m running a node?
Please pull the latest version of https://github.com/HorizenLabs/compose-evm-testnet-simplified/tree/0.1.0-SNAPSHOT8, checkout tag ‘0.1.0-SNAPSHOT8’ and run “docker compose up -d” to upgrade your node. What will happen if I don’t upgrade my node in time?
Your node will be unable to synchronize new blocks. As soon as you upgrade the node it should start functioning normally again.

The post EON Updates: Upcoming Gobi Testnet Upgrade appeared first on Horizen Blog.

Nym - Medium

Nym in Prague — the European hub of privacy

Nym in Prague — the European hub of privacy Advancing privacy across ecosystems at Prague blockchain week Nym CEO Harry Halpin at Gateway to Cosmos, Prague 2023 Most of the Nym team have just returned from a busy week in Prague for the blockchain week in what is arguably Europe’s main hub of privacy technologists these days! Prague blockchain week was packed with events across eco
Nym in Prague — the European hub of privacy Advancing privacy across ecosystems at Prague blockchain week Nym CEO Harry Halpin at Gateway to Cosmos, Prague 2023

Most of the Nym team have just returned from a busy week in Prague for the blockchain week in what is arguably Europe’s main hub of privacy technologists these days!

Prague blockchain week was packed with events across ecosystems. And given that Nym is a chain agnostic privacy layer, the team was active on and off stage discussing with friends and fellow privacy activists, zk-researchers, devs, anthropologists and entrepreneurs across Cosmos, Ethereum and the Lunarpunk ecosystems…

From Paralelni Polis to a number of local independent efforts to mature the privacy space, the cypherpunk movement is kept alive and growing. People from the Nym team in fact organised the biggest privacy event during Prague blockchain week — the very first Web3 Privacy Summit!

Max Hampshire and Mykola Siusko of Nym and Guy Zyskind at Web3 Privacy Summit, Prague 2023 Key highlights of the week: Gateway to Cosmos where Nym CEO Harry Halpin gave a talk on ‘Privacy on the new Nyx IBC blockchain and Nym mixnet’ Nym team had the privilege of meeting Ellie and Hans who have independently built “Nym-hole” a local Nym router which they pitched during the Cosmos Pitch Competition: github.com/dial0ut The workshop by Nym Integrations Lead, Nadim Kobeissi: ‘Hands-on with the Nym mixnet and Nyx blockchain workshop’. He was assisted by Harry and Serinko Nym’s newest DevRel. The Web3 Privacy Summit — organised by Mykola Siusko of Nym team and featuring 20+ speakers from Ethereum Foundation, Nym and more…! DevRel lead Max Hampshire was on stage at the Summit speaking about ‘Maintaining privacy infrastructure’ with Max Guy Ziskynd. “The task is how to bring people in, via rewards but also the broader ideological vision”. Newest Nym addition to DevRel, Serinko, was also on stage discussing how privacy can enable human rights. It is highly recommended to watch the recordings from the summit, especially the phenomenal Rachel-Rose O’Leary on the rise of Lunarpunk! Privacy in Cosmos — where Nadim gave a talk on Winning the Crypto Wars!

Finally, the Czech beers also deserve a special mention as a highlight! Undoubtedly Serinko who is still in town for EthPrague is enjoying one right now while discussing mixnets for Ethereum consensus clients… go find him for a chat!

Join Nym Community

Twitter // Discord // Telegram // Element

Nym in Prague — the European hub of privacy was originally published in nymtech on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

a16z Podcast

The Electrification of Everything: From Sky to Sea

Demand for electric cars is booming. More than 10 million electric cars were sold worldwide in 2022, and consumer behavior is changing as more people embrace alternative and sustainable modes of mobility. While the electrification movement is a critical element of climate action, it also presents new challenges - from the sky to the sea. In this episode, industry experts Gregory Davis, CEO of Ev

Demand for electric cars is booming. More than 10 million electric cars were sold worldwide in 2022, and consumer behavior is changing as more people embrace alternative and sustainable modes of mobility.

While the electrification movement is a critical element of climate action, it also presents new challenges - from the sky to the sea.

In this episode, industry experts Gregory Davis, CEO of Eviation Planes, Mitch Lee, co-founder and CEO of Arc Boats, and Duncan McIntyre, founder and CEO of Highland Electric Fleets, dive into how the electrification movement is shaping the future of transport and technology.

Topics Covered:

00:00 - Introduction 03:29 - The sustainable aviation industry 04:47 - Electric school, municipal and government vehicles 07:57 - Electric boats 10:49 - What can be transferred from the EV car market? 14:06 - Battery challenges and architecture 19:06 - Providing grid services  22:55 - Building a multimodal business 33:19 - Gaps in the market 46:16 - Do you make, buy, or borrow? 57:26 - What does the future look like for each industry?

Verida

Verida Wallet — The Ultimate Guide to Getting Started

Verida Wallet — The Ultimate Guide to Getting Started With the growing adoption of web3 and the emergence of wallets, Verida has built a digital wallet that holds and protects its users’ crypto as well as private encrypted data. In this article, we will take a closer look at Verida Wallet, its key features and benefits, and how it works. Verida Wallet is more than just a crypto wallet;
Verida Wallet — The Ultimate Guide to Getting Started

With the growing adoption of web3 and the emergence of wallets, Verida has built a digital wallet that holds and protects its users’ crypto as well as private encrypted data. In this article, we will take a closer look at Verida Wallet, its key features and benefits, and how it works.

Verida Wallet is more than just a crypto wallet; it’s a gateway to a new world of decentralized identity, allowing users to control their personal data, manage digital credentials and securely communicate with other applications and users.

Data is now one of the most important assets for both individuals and corporations in the modern digital age. Data privacy and security have, however, grown to be very important issues for many people due to the rise in data breaches and the exploitation of personal information.

As a potential response to these issues, Verida has built a digital wallet that is capable of decentralized data management with evolved sharing systems that give users more control over their personal data and more effective methods of sharing it with others. You know the saying “Not your keys, not your crypto”; for Verida we extend that to data, “not your keys, not your data”.

Things you should know about the Verida Wallet

Verida Wallet is built on top of the Verida Protocol. It is a decentralized, user-centric wallet that allows users to securely store, manage, and share their data across multiple decentralized applications (dApps) and platforms.

The wallet uses the w3c decentralized identifier (DID) standard for maximum compatibility. User identities can be found via a public address or a friendly username. Users can manage multiple identities to separate their anonymous work and even personal information. Each identity has a public profile, you can share as much or as little information as you like, you can also connect web2 accounts and crypto wallets to showcase who you are to the world. A built-in multi-chain crypto wallet supports Polygon, Ethereum, NEAR and Algorand.

Verida Wallet is a user-focused wallet for decentralized data management and helping you gain control over your personal data.

Core Features of the Verida Wallet

Verida Wallet is a mobile application with a comprehensive data management platform for end-users that provides private key management and a user-friendly interface for interacting with the Verida network and other supported networks. It consists of several components, such as:

Decentralized Identity

The Verida Wallet allows users to create new decentralized identities, create new blockchain wallets, manage private keys, and facilitate single sign-on which provides simple, consensual authentication and authorization across an ecosystem of decentralized applications.

Zero-Knowledge and Verifiable Credentials

The wallet also supports verifiable credentials that meet the w3c specification, the wallet supports credentials on the Cheqd network, Verida Network, as well as zero-knowledge credentials on the Polygon ID network. Users can connect and receive their credentials, store them on the Verida Network and then use them to prove information about themselves, either in a zero-knowledge way or using standard credentials

Crypto Tokens, NFTs and Transactions

Users earn incentives in the form of Verida token rewards by using the Verida network. You can perform transactions and manage crypto on your favourite blockchains. Verida Wallet allows users to interact with any supported blockchain by signing transactions, managing NFTs/Collectibles, and viewing or minting Soulbound Tokens/Badges.

User Data

With the Verida Wallet, you are in control of your personal data. You can apply a set of delegated permissions when sharing it with other users and services.

Users can take ownership of their data that exists on web2 platforms by storing the encrypted data on the Verida Network in the wallet, and this data is then available for web3 applications to request access. It also provides users with a secure and decentralized storage solution for managing their personal data.

Encrypted Inbox

The Inbox feature, a secure data inbox built into the Verida Wallet allows messages, requests, and data to be safely sent or received to other users or third-party services. The inbox can be used by to grant permission to requests for accessing user data or synchronize large amounts of data. Users can receive notifications and messages and respond to requests from their inbox.

Profiles

Profiles in the Verida Wallet allows users to create and manage both public and private profiles that can be shared with third parties. Users can manage their public profile, which contains information such as name (or pseudonym), avatar and profile description. The public profile is available for reuse across applications.

Single Sign On

The wallet also supports QR code single sign-on with rapid onboarding for users that don’t have a crypto wallet. You can easily and quickly sign-on to take advantage of the wallet features to manage and store your data securely.

WalletConnect

With the WalletConnect (v1 & v2) integration, the Verida Wallet has enhanced security for crypto transactions and provide a secure, reliable connection to dapps on multiple chains.

How to Set Up Verida Wallet

Verida Wallet is a powerful and flexible platform for managing decentralized identity, personal data and crypto. Built on the Verida Network, Verida Wallet provides users with a decentralized and secure way to manage their data across multiple decentralized applications and platforms.

Let’s walk you through the steps of getting started with Verida Wallet, from creating a new DID to managing your profiles and data.

Step 1: Download and Install Verida Wallet

The first step in getting started with Verida Wallet is to download and install the app on your device. Verida Wallet is available for download on iOS and Android devices and can be found in the App Store and Google Play Store, respectively.

Use this QR code or visit verida.io to download the Verida Wallet

Scan to download the Verida Wallet Step 2: Create a New Identity

Once you have downloaded and installed Verida Wallet, the next step is to create a new DID/Identity. To create a new Identity, simply follow the on-screen prompts and provide the required information, such as your name and country. Then record your seed phrases in a secure place.

Step 3: Set Up Your Profiles

After creating a new Identity, the next step is to set up your profile. Profiles are a key feature of Verida Wallet and allow you to create and manage both public and private profiles that can be shared with third parties. To set up your profiles, simply navigate to the “Profiles” tab in the app and follow the on-screen prompts.

Step 4: Customize Your Settings

Once you have set up your Identity and profiles, the next step is to customize your settings. Verida Wallet offers a wide range of customizable settings, including security settings, privacy settings, and notification settings. To customize your settings, simply navigate to the “Settings” tab in the app and choose the options that best suit your needs.

Step 5: Explore the Verida Network

After completing the setup process, the final step is to explore the Verida Network. Verida Wallet is currently on testnet, and compatible with a wide range of demo decentralized applications and services. To get started, simply browse the available demos, which include the Account Explorer, Credential Issuer, Markdown Editor and Polygon ID Zero-Knowledge Credential demo.

Step 5a: Account Explorer

Verida Account Explorer is a new application designed to show the public profile of any user on the Verida network. With the Account Explorer, you can search for your Identity/DID, or find other DIDs. You can try out the Account Explorer or watch the demo video.

Step 5b: Markdown Editor

The Verida Markdown Editor is a decentralized note-taking application which integrates with the Verida Datastore library and allows users to save encrypted notes to their database. You can try out the Markdown Editor or watch the demo video.

Step 5c: Polygon ID ZK Proofs

The Verida Wallet is the first mobile crypto wallet to support Polygon ID Zero Knowledge credentials that allow individuals to prove only the necessary information required for a transaction without having to expose any of their private information. This Verida-Polygon ID integration will unlock a new class of decentralized applications where personal data, reputation, and real-world identity can be used privately and securely.

Generate your zero-knowledge proof credential with the Polygon ID user guide or watch the demo video.

Download the Verida Wallet for iOS or Android at verida.io. About Verida

The Verida Wallet is a self-custody web3 mobile wallet. It’s more than just crypto, it’s a gateway to a new world of decentralized identity. Users can manage their identity, sign into apps, manage their personal data, their credentials, receive messages and manage crypto. The wallet connects users to the self-sovereign Verida Network, the most secure, encrypted decentralized storage solution for web3. This ensures all user data and credentials are secured by a user’s private key.

Learn more about Verida Build on the Verida Network Download the Verida Wallet Join the Verida One wait list Follow us on Twitter Join the conversation on Discord Explore developer documentation Ask us a question on Telegram

Verida Wallet — The Ultimate Guide to Getting Started was originally published in Verida on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

Nym - Medium

Welcome to the Nym Delegators Program!

Congratulations to all the selected Nym mix nodes The Nym delegators program is commencing this week. The Nym treasury will delegate a stake of 200k NYM tokens to each of the selected mix nodes to boost their reputation in the mixnet. These delegations will remain until the nodes reach 70% saturation after which they will have built sufficient community reputation to independently continue p
Congratulations to all the selected Nym mix nodes

The Nym delegators program is commencing this week. The Nym treasury will delegate a stake of 200k NYM tokens to each of the selected mix nodes to boost their reputation in the mixnet. These delegations will remain until the nodes reach 70% saturation after which they will have built sufficient community reputation to independently continue providing high quality privacy services to the world.

After 6 weeks of application process, selection and interviews — and far far more very high quality submissions than expected! — 41 fantastic node operators from across the world have been selected for the program. This is nearly double the number that was initially intended for the program, simply due to the high interest and quality of applications.

Throughout the program these mix node operators will also enjoy mentorship of two of Nym’s finest and most experienced mix node operators:

Cgi-bin from No Trust Verify Wunderbaer from Hermes Stakepool

Cgi-bin and Wunderbear will support with best practices and know-how to run outstanding mix nodes and attract community delegations.

I got selected, what happens next?

If you were selected, make sure to join the designated Element space before EOD Friday, June 9th. You will have received instructions via email.

Your delegations will be staked by EOD Monday, June 12th.

Over the next 2 weeks, you will get to know other operators in the program, your mentors, form teams and pitch contributions.

I applied but didn’t get selected — why?

Mix nodes were disqualified for the following reasons:

Failing to meet one or more of the selection criteria. In most cases, this meant the mix node was not located in an underrepresented region. The mix node operator was not reachable (incorrect email address, no response).

This still left many eligible mix nodes! Which meant that 41 mix nodes were selected instead of the planned 25. When creating the shortlist, other factors were also considered, including:

Testnet participation Community activity Shipyard Academy participation

Don’t get discouraged though — this is just the first cohort of the Nym Delegations Program and there will be others in the future.

In the meantime, learn about the Nym mission, join the brand new Node Operator Element channel, meet other community members — and make sure to apply again next time!

Final note

The overall goal is to improve quality and support further decentralisation of the Nym mixnet in terms of geography and VPS providers. The program is aimed at helping participants gain recognition in the community through their contributions.

This is the first iteration of the Nym Delegations Program. The impact on the mixnet and token economics will be monitored and changes will be made as necessary for any future cohorts (Such as the number of participants, delegation amounts, selection criteria, etc.)

Join Nym Community

Twitter // Discord // Telegram // Element

Welcome to the Nym Delegators Program! was originally published in nymtech on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

Circle Blog

Arbitrum USDC Now Available

Arbitrum USDC is here! We’re excited to announce that USDC is now available natively on Arbitrum and accessible to developers and their users – no bridging required. Circle Account and Circle APIs enable businesses to access Arbitrum USDC and take advantage of faster settlement times and lower costs offered by the Arbitrum network.

Arbitrum USDC is here! We’re excited to announce that USDC is now available natively on Arbitrum and accessible to developers and their users – no bridging required. Circle Account and Circle APIs enable businesses to access Arbitrum USDC and take advantage of faster settlement times and lower costs offered by the Arbitrum network.

ConsenSys Blog

MetaMask Institutional and Fireblocks Integrate to Offer Unrivaled DeFi and Web3 Access to Institutional Investors and Builders

Zaisan

Is Blockchain Technology Sustainable?

It is strongly believed that blockchain technology can be the missing puzzle piece to explicate the crossing of digitalisation and sustainability. Blockchain technology gives the opportunity to focus on the complete triple bottom line, instead of on single pillars. In today’s business landscape, sustainability has become a key differentiating factor for enterprises. The upcoming booms […] The po

It is strongly believed that blockchain technology can be the missing puzzle piece to explicate the crossing of digitalisation and sustainability. Blockchain technology gives the opportunity to focus on the complete triple bottom line, instead of on single pillars.

In today’s business landscape, sustainability has become a key differentiating factor for enterprises. The upcoming booms are rooted in digitalisation and sustainability. Still, there are problems with current sustainability approaches. One major problem is greenwashing, where organisations claim their initiative to be way more sustainable than it actually is. Additionally, sustainability strategies often only serve single sustainability pillars, instead of sustainability as a whole. More and more enterprises are now investing in digital technologies as a means to achieve their sustainability goals.

Three pillars of sustainability

This article is an introduction to a deeper explanation found in our ebook: Using Blockchain for Sustainability.

Often, sustainability is solely associated with the environmental aspect, but it encompasses much more than that. In essence, sustainability is about achieving continuous growth within an enterprise. It is built upon three fundamental pillars that are often referred to as the “triple bottom line” (TBL).

Economic Sustainability (Profit): Includes all aspects within the business, which aim towards creating economic growth without colliding with environmental and social needs Social Sustainability (People): Includes all social features a business should imply, in order to create a planet driven by equal and inclusive manners Environmental Sustainability (Planet): Can be defined as the attention of a business to act and adjust in favor of the planet

All in all, it is the mixture of all three pillars that allow for a fitting plan of action. The idea of creating shared value is a good representation of what sustainability consists of. Whilst focusing on the triple bottom line, businesses simultaneously do such whilst still aiming for profitability, cost-effectiveness, and risk mitigation. So where can blockchain play a role, to cater to all those goals?

ESG

Another term that has gained popularity is ESG goals (Environmental, Social, and Governance). ESG goals primarily focus on monitoring and controlling business activities and business performance toward achieving sustainability. In contrast, the triple bottom line looks at the business from a wider perspective by taking into account sustainability beyond the four walls of the organisation.

A power couple: Blockchain technology driving sustainability

More and more have jumped on the blockchain bandwagon and the interest is assumed to only increase in the future. To keep it short and simple: the main function of blockchain technology is secure data storage and information sharing (transactions) across a wide network. The main reason, as to why blockchain can be a key to sustainability improvements are its characteristics of being: 

Decentralised Transparent Accessible Secure

All in all, blockchain technology’s transparent and decentralised nature allows for open communication and traceability of data. It can drive internal efficiency through automation and smart contracts and embraces financial and social inclusion. These are only a few of blockchain technology’s many advantages concerning sustainability.

Key takeaways Businesses are investing in digital technologies to achieve their sustainability goals. Economic insights Blockchain technology’s transparent and decentralised nature allows for open communication, internal efficiency through automation and smart contracts, and financial and social inclusion, making it a key factor in achieving sustainability.  Using blockchain technology for supply chain management can help businesses achieve their sustainability goals by promoting a circular economy, increasing transparency, and improving efficiency through automation with smart contracts. Social insights Social sustainability is becoming increasingly important, and blockchain technology can help with financial and social inclusion by promoting trust and accountability and enabling equitable and sustainable development. DAOs offer businesses an approach to decision-making that includes contributions from anyone in the community, promoting diversity and strengthening of community management. Blockchain technology can be used for charity purposes to build trust with donors by providing a transparent ecosystem where donations can be tracked and verified. Environmental insights Decentralised waste management systems through blockchain can streamline coordination with waste removal organisations, incentivise environmentally friendly waste disposal practices, and engage consumers in businesses’ sustainability efforts. Blockchain technology can help create a more efficient and sustainable renewable energy market, providing cost-effectiveness, regulatory compliance, and competitive advantage for organisations investing in renewable energy. Carbon credits and offsets can be traded on the blockchain, creating an additional revenue stream for organisations and demonstrating their commitment to environmental sustainability. Barriers to the adoption of blockchain include a lack of knowledge, a steep learning curve, data compliance, the conception of blockchain as a major energy consumer, and cost-efficiency. For a deeper understanding of how blockchain can help businesses to go green, read here. How Zaisan can help you

At Zaisan, we are dedicated to keeping up with the latest developments in blockchain technology, how it impacts sustainability, and providing you with the best support and advice.

Europechain by Zaisan is a next-generation and public blockchain, which can cater to your sustainability goals. Europechain is a carbon-neutral, and GDPR-supportive chain, which offers security and efficiency for your enterprise.

The post Is Blockchain Technology Sustainable? appeared first on Zaisan.

Nym - Medium

Privacy — what is it good for?

Privacy — what is it good for? The concept of privacy in and of itself hardly means much. In fact, in some languages, the word doesn’t even exist! Instead, people use terms like dignity, security or integrity to describe what it means for people to be free from continuous observation. Let’s explore this a bit… Ensuring dignity Dignity implies having the peace and quiet to go about doi
Privacy — what is it good for?

The concept of privacy in and of itself hardly means much. In fact, in some languages, the word doesn’t even exist! Instead, people use terms like dignity, security or integrity to describe what it means for people to be free from continuous observation. Let’s explore this a bit…

Ensuring dignity

Dignity implies having the peace and quiet to go about doing the things you need to do as a human without being observed, judged and attacked by others. For example, being able to work or study without your boss or teacher observing you and controlling your behaviour at all times. This implies that there is trust in you, respect for your abilities to explore, learn, create and develop and you are treated as a dignified person.

In a healthy workplace or school, the pressure of scrutiny, judgement and intervention is only applied during a review, project delivery or at an exam, not continuously. Online privacy protections enable you to maintain your dignity by ensuring you can work, create and explore online without being continuously monitored and monitized.

Ensuring security

Security is probably one of the most common associations with privacy. Privacy protections enable security by protecting the aspects of your person that might otherwise come under attack. Especially in the online world, in repressive regimes and high risk contexts. Ideas, values, backgrounds and perceptions of the world diverge to such a degree that people can quickly become threatened.

The security offered by strong privacy of communications is often undermined because it is thought that this is better for combating crime. But actually, criminals operate best when there is slack security. Opening back doors on everyone by compromising end-to-end encryption or turning a blind eye to mass-surveillance opens everyone up to targeting and manipulation by criminals and corporations. When mass surveillance is the norm, privacy protections become a luxury only the few (and often criminals) can afford. And this leaves the rest of society at their mercy without the same levels of protection.

Ensuring integrity

Integrity is a more abstract concept, but extremely important. It is best explained in reference to our physical body: our physical body is a single entity. The integrity of our body is generally protected by law, common practice and hippocratic oaths — a doctor needs your clear consent before intervening, organ trafficking is heavily penalised, and so on. We generally do not allow people to penetrate the integrity of our bodies without clear understanding and agreement on why and for what purpose (surgery for example).

Our mental and emotional processes are deserving of an equal level of integrity. They are part of who we are as individuals. But the profiling and targeting enabled through mass surveillance has turned our mental and emotional processes into data points bought and sold on digital marketplaces, free to trade and exploited by the highest bidder.

Protecting the undefined parts of ourselves and society

Finally, every one of us have parts of our identities that are unformed and still figuring things out. In order for people and societies to develop and grow, there needs to be space for the undefined — the parts we are not sure about yet, that are still experimental, tentative where we can try new ways of being and doing. This is a sensitive condition. We are likely to make mistakes or do things we later regret. The freedom to make mistakes and try out risky things is essential for discovery, creativity and wonder. Privacy enables this by protecting against premature observation, calculation and judgement.

If privacy enables dignity, security and integrity, it is worth considering: what does surveillance enable? The primary aims of surveillance are control, targeting and intervention. Whether criminals or consumers, the technology is the same: mass surveillance to calculate who to target, how to control and intervene in their behaviour. Understanding this difference between the two gives an understanding of the type of society that emerges if privacy or in contrast, surveillance is the default of society: dignity, security and integrity versus control, targeting and intervention.

Lately, privacy tools have been increasingly met with fear and concerns. This has resulted in regulations hostile to financial privacy and the undermining of protections, with the argument being that privacy provides a cover for criminals. But the truth is that the inverse is the case: the lack of privacy and the dominance of mass surveillance makes us all vulnerable to targeting by criminals and corporations.

The cypherpunks have a saying: transparency for the powerful, privacy for the rest of us. A society that ensures privacy as a default and embeds this as a principle in our shared infrastructures is a society that ensures dignity, security and integrity.

Resources Privacy in the age of interconnectivity (podcast) Digital integrity (blogpost) Interview on digital integrity with Alexis Roussel (video) FR with ENG subtitles Fireside with Chelsea Manning and Jaya Klara Brekke (video) Languages

Turkish // Russian // Chinese

Join Nym Community

Twitter // Discord // Telegram // Element

Privacy — what is it good for? was originally published in nymtech on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

Circle Press

Circle Singapore Obtained Major Payment Institution (MPI) License

SINGAPORE & BOSTON, 7 June 2023 — Circle Internet Singapore Pte. Ltd. (Circle Singapore), an affiliate of Circle Internet Financial, LLC (Circle), has obtained a Major Payment Institution (MPI) license from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). The license allows Circle Singapore to offer digital payment token services, alongside cross-border money transfer services and domesti

SINGAPORE & BOSTON, 7 June 2023 — Circle Internet Singapore Pte. Ltd. (Circle Singapore), an affiliate of Circle Internet Financial, LLC (Circle), has obtained a Major Payment Institution (MPI) license from the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). The license allows Circle Singapore to offer digital payment token services, alongside cross-border money transfer services and domestic money transfer services in the city-state via its various products and services, including the Circle Account, which allows institutional customers access to USDC. USDC, issued by Circle, is a digital dollar, also known as a stablecoin, that is available 24/7 and moves at internet speed.

Horizen - Blog

Horizen Partners with Ankr as One of the First RPC Providers for EON, Horizen’s EVM-Compatible Smart Contracting Platform

This strategic partnership brings enhanced accessibility, scalability, and reliability to the rapidly growing EON ecosystem. We are excited to announce a strategic partnership with Ankr, a leading Web3 infrastructure provider. This collaboration will make Ankr one of the first Remote Procedure Call (RPC) providers for EON, Horizen’s new EVM-compatible smart contracting platform. The partnership

This strategic partnership brings enhanced accessibility, scalability, and reliability to the rapidly growing EON ecosystem.

We are excited to announce a strategic partnership with Ankr, a leading Web3 infrastructure provider. This collaboration will make Ankr one of the first Remote Procedure Call (RPC) providers for EON, Horizen’s new EVM-compatible smart contracting platform. The partnership will bring additional accessibility, scalability, and reliability to the burgeoning EON ecosystem by supporting a wide range of use cases, including DeFi, gaming, and NFTs.

Horizen’s EON is a fully EVM-compatible smart contracting platform and the first of many smart contract sidechains on the Horizen ecosystem. Ankr’s state-of-the-art Web3 infrastructure and services will enable Horizen EON to further optimize its performance and accessibility for developers and end-users alike. With Ankr’s high-performance RPC node infrastructure, EON will be able to handle any request load, making it more scalable and efficient.

“The collaboration between Horizen and Ankr will significantly enhance the EON ecosystem’s capabilities, delivering unmatched value to developers and users alike. Ankr’s cutting-edge technology and suite of developer tools will not only bolster EON’s scalability and accessibility but also empower our developers to create innovative, secure, and efficient dApps across various use cases.“

– Rob Viglione, Co-founder, Horizen, Co-founder and CEO of Horizen Labs

Through this collaboration, Ankr will also provide a suite of developer tools to help create and deploy smart contract applications on EON quickly and easily. These tools include the Liquid Staking SDK, Web3 Gaming SDK, and AppChains As a Service, empowering dApp developers to build innovative and scalable Web3 applications on EON.

“Our collaboration with Horizen is a testament to Ankr’s dedication to developers looking to build innovative solutions upgraded by the zero-knowledge movement. By providing readily accessible connections to EON, Ankr can assist in powering the leading edge of smart contract technology as it plays a vital part in scaling Web3 to the next billion users.“

– Josh Neuroth, Head of Product, Ankr.

Horizen EON is currently live on its permanent public testnet, Gobi, which is supported by a network of products, integrations, and tools, which now also include Ankr. With the launch of a partnership between Horizen and Ankr, the EON ecosystem is poised to welcome a wealth of dApps and services in the coming months. The combination of EON’s EVM compatibility, Horizen’s zero-knowledge enabled cross-chain protocol, and Ankr’s cutting-edge Web3 infrastructure will create a permissionless, interoperable, and customizable blockchain ecosystem for developers and users alike.

About Ankr

Ankr is a decentralized Web3 infrastructure company that provides services to more than 30 proof-of-stake chains through a top-tier global node delivery system and RPC aggregator. Handling over 2 trillion transactions annually across Web3, Ankr has established itself as the foremost infrastructure provider for blockchains like BSC, Fantom, and Polygon, and more recently, enterprise technology companies like Microsoft. Additionally, Ankr offers an array of developer tools such as the Liquid Staking SDK, Web3 Gaming SDK, and AppChains As a Service, enabling dApp developers to efficiently create Web3 applications.

The post Horizen Partners with Ankr as One of the First RPC Providers for EON, Horizen’s EVM-Compatible Smart Contracting Platform appeared first on Horizen Blog.

Nym tutorial contest! Share your expertise on the Nym privacy system — and earn rewards

Welcome to the Nym Tutorial Contest, inviting passionate community members like you to share and showcase your expertise. Create step-by-step tutorials on using the NymConnect app and/or the Nym Wallet and win tokens!

The community are the Nym experts: many of you have been running infrastructure and testing out Nym tools since the very early testnets.

Get creative and help others navigate the world of Nym with informative and engaging content.

Contest Details

Between May 30 and June 25th, you are encouraged to create compelling tutorial articles, presentations, videos, or infographics that provide valuable insights into using the Nym Wallet and leveraging the power of the NymConnect app.

As a requirement, it is mandatory to share your tutorial on Twitter, ensuring that you tag the Nym Twitter account and include the hashtag #NYM in your tweet. This will help us track and promote your tutorial effectively.

Thank you for your cooperation!

GET STARTED Categories

Choose one of the following categories for your tutorial submission:

Nym Wallet Mastery: Learn how to create and manage a Nym wallet, ensuring the utmost privacy and security. NymConnect Explained: Dive into the functionalities of NymConnect and demonstrate how it enhances your privacy and anonymizes your online activities. Submission Guidelines:

To make your tutorial stand out, please adhere to the following guidelines:

Requirement: As part of the contest guidelines, it is essential that you share your tutorial on Twitter, ensuring that you tag our Twitter account and include the hashtag $NYM in your tweet. Format: Create a video (minimum 3 minutes), a PDF, a PowerPoint (PPT) presentation, or an infographic. Language: Submissions should be in English, Russian, Turkish, Spanish, Portuguese, Vietnamese, Japanese, Chinese or French. Quality Matters: Ensure your content is visually appealing with clear video footage, images, slides, or frames. Originality and Creativity: Impress with your innovative approach, demonstrating your understanding of NymConnect or/and the Nym Wallet. Practical Implementation: Provide practical examples, use cases, and real-world scenarios to demonstrate the potential of Nym’s offerings. How to Participate:

Once your tutorial meets the above criteria, submit it via the provided Gleam before the deadline.

Remember, originality, clarity, and practicality are the key factors that will determine the winners. Additionally, make sure you share it on Twitter.

Rewards:

The top 5 winners will each receive a generous reward of $400 in NYM tokens, acknowledging their outstanding contributions to the Nym community and the revolution in online privacy.

Note: All decisions regarding winners will be made at Nym’s sole discretion and are final. Nym may request minor edits to tutorials to ensure eligibility for a prize. Prizes can only be awarded to individuals who have completed the necessary KYC checks.

Resources to Get Started

To aid you in your tutorial creation process, make use of the following resources:

Download NymConnect How to use NymConnect NymConnect Beta Announcement Getting started with NymConnect: privacy-enhance apps you are already using | Nym 101 How to use NymConnect for Telegram About Nym

For more information, updates, and inspiration, follow Nym on Twitter

Disclaimer: Participation in this program is only available to individuals who do not reside in locations that makes them ineligible to participate and/or receive prizes, including:

The USA, Central African Republic, Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, Libya, North Korea, Somalia, South Sudan, Sudan, Syria, Venezuela, Yemen, and Russian occupied regions of Ukraine (including Crimea, and parts of Donetsk and Luhansk).

Prior to receiving NYM token rewards for this program, participants are required to successfully complete KYC verification with Nym’s KYC provider of choice. Nym reserves the right to determine the final outcome of the activity and disqualify any participants without prior notice or recourse for any reason, including fraudulent behavior and failure to adhere to the Nym Code of Conduct.

Nym tutorial contest was originally published in nymtech on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

09:47 • 22 days ago

Monday, 05. June 2023

Panther Protocol

Monthly Update - May 2023

It's the end of the month again. As such, it’s time to reflect on the progress we made in the last month. Let’s start with our monthly update.

Dear Panthers,

It's the end of the month again. As such, it’s time to reflect on the progress we made in the last month.

Let’s start with our monthly update.

Tech Updates v1 fees and rewards

Panther v1's fees and rewards are fully developed, now being tested using simulations to replicate real-world product activity cases. This is a milestone that will inform many decisions for Panther's release, as well as critical for the user experience throughout the product.

Furthermore, we have made significant progress on our relayers integration.

Gasless transactions and Relayers

Panther’s relayers are now also developed and interacting with external entities, enabling many testing use cases. Panther is also creating dApp nodes to support our activity in a decentralized way. Acting as intermediaries between Panther's privacy layer and the decentralized network, relayers support our privacy-preserving stack by obfuscating the origin of transactions, making it difficult for third parties to trace them.

Relayers can also be used to pay for gas in users’ name, adding an extra layer of anonymity to transactions. This integration is expected to significantly increase privacy by making it harder to link transactions to specific users.

v1 prototyping Panther’s v1 is underway!!

v1 is not an MVP for Panther. It is a self-contained, finalized DeFi product that will protect users’ data and open new possibilities for institutional and retail users.

With v1's visual components finalized, just a few features are pending definition. We're nearing a point where prototypes are complete and gearing up towards upcoming releases. Some key parameters are also finalized, and, as mentioned above, we’re completing the fees and rewards schemes that will support the protocol. The main goal is to present a system that balances flexibility with maximum utility for $ZKP.

More work is also focusing on the mechanisms through which users exchange PRPs for $zZKP and their associated rewards. The main goal of this system is to balance on-chain privacy's value with utility, empowering users to make the most out of protocol rewards.

Finally, progress is ongoing with compliance support through third-party Web3 integrations that leverage ZK tech.

Panther’s SNARK: PMONK

Our CTO and Chief Scientist, Anish Mohammed, presented a research paper on Panther’s SNARK: PMONK (Permutations over Monomial-bases for Oecumenical Noninteractive arguments of Knowledge), at the Leading Privacy Alliance’s summit in Istanbul, Turkey.

You can watch his presentation on Youtube:

Keep an eye out for more updates on PMONK and other advancements in the Panther Protocol ecosystem! The published paper by the Panther team can also be found here.

Governance

We are thrilled to announce that the Panther DAO has officially approved PIP-14. This proposal formalizes the project’s Governance Framework and introduces a DAO Council formed by three highly reputable individuals external to Panther’s development.

PIP-14 on Snapshot. Who is in Panther’s DAO Council?

Santiago Velez, Jillian Godsil, and Debra Farber will serve as the inaugural Panther DAO Council members. They will be responsible for vetting proposals before they reach the community voting stage.

As per their track record…

Santiago Velez is the co-Founder and Division Lead (R&D) at Block Digital Corporation, as well as VP of R&D at Sindric Solutions, LLC. He's also a former Nuclear Engineer, VP of UWUA L590 Engineers Union, and Panther Protocol user.

Jillian Godsil is a journalist, broadcaster, influencer, CEO, writer, former European Parliament candidate and Law Changer. She is also a Panther Protocol user & early contributor.

Debra Farber is host of The Shifting Privacy Left Podcast, as well as CEO, Principled LLC, and Advisor to the PrivacyTech Rise, Privado, the Institute of Operational Privacy Design, and XRSI.

Welcome, Panther DAO Council! Governance framework The community’s framework for building a more robust and decentralized Panther Protocol.

A large part of PIP-14 involved the Panther community establishing a new governance framework and formalizing it.

This landmark development follows extensive discussions on our community forum about the need for a decentralized, high-level decision-making process, and accountability for non-team members. The governance framework also formalizes implicit rules and guidelines for the community and technology contributors to collaborate in a decentralized way where every community member can make their voice heard.

We wrote about the significance of PIP-14 here.

Ecosystem Events

Co-founder Oliver Gale is scheduled to speak at the European Blockchain Convention 2023 in Barcelona!

Oliver will be sharing his perspectives on privacy with the Blockchain Conference's 5000 Web3 ecosystem attendees.

Let us know if you'd like to schedule a meet!

#EBC2023 with Oliver Gale

Oliver also participated in the Global Family Office Summit 2023, organized by GDA Capital & SD - Global Markets. It was an excellent opportunity to share his insights on 'Privacy Solutions for a Digital World.'

We’ll soon be sharing clips and videos from his participation.

Oliver Gale on Privacy Solutions for a Digital World

Following this, co-founder Anish Mohammed joined a panel discussion with experts from ZeroSync, Mystiko Network, and the Fosun Web3 Fund on May 24th. They focused on the potential of Zero-Knowledge Proofs in building the Future of Bitcoin.

Anish Mohammed on ZK-Proofs and the future of Bitcoin.

Finally, Anish will also be speaking about “Data Sovereignty and user identity perspective in DeFi” during the Emerge Conference on May 28th in Dubai, alongside experts from Binance, NFT3com, and Cryptomeria Capital.

😎

Co-Founder Oliver Gale was also at the #Bitcoin Conf this May, connecting with key Bitcoin and Web3 ecosystem contributors.

Did you run into Oliver at the conference? 👀

Panther will also be a partner of the Web3 Privacy Summit. We recognize that sustainable privacy within DeFi is a community effort and are happy to lend our support to an initiative that recognizes the need for privacy literacy.

Clips, Podcasts, and Video

CEO Oliver Gale joined an all-star privacy panel with XX Network. Check it out for great insights on on-chain data:

On the possibility of enabling institutions and enterprises to use Panther without risking regulatory violations, and how Panther v1 tackles this issue:

Panther Protocol v1 will offer a suite of privacy tools including zBridges & #DeFi adaptors to tap into existing cross-chain liquidity and access smart contracts.

Co-founder & CEO @OriginalOlii explains the potential for DeFi extensibility and privacy staking rewards on the… pic.twitter.com/TUudRm1zRV

— Panther Protocol (@ZKPanther) May 11, 2023
About Panther

Panther is a decentralized protocol that enables interoperable privacy in DeFi using zero-knowledge proofs.

Users can mint fully-collateralized, composable tokens called zAssets, which can be used to execute private, trusted DeFi transactions across multiple blockchains.

Panther helps investors protect their personal financial data and trading strategies, and provides financial institutions with a clear path to compliantly participate in DeFi.

Website · One-pager · Lite Paper · Twitter · Telegram · Discord
